org.logevents

Class LogEventFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.logevents.LogEventFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILoggerFactory

    public class LogEventFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements ILoggerFactory
    LogEventFactory holds all active loggers and lets you set the level and observers for these. It implements ILoggerFactory and is the entry point of Log Events as an SLF4J implementation.

    At startup time, this class will use a LogEventConfigurator specified with ServiceLoader to set up the log configuration. If none is available, DefaultLogEventConfigurator will be used.

    Use setRootLevel(Level) and setLevel(Logger, Level) to configure the threshold for logging at one level. If null is specified, the parent log chain will be searched for a log level threshold.

    Use addObserver(java.lang.String, org.logevents.LogEventObserver), addRootObserver(org.logevents.LogEventObserver), setObserver(java.lang.String, org.logevents.LogEventObserver) and setRootObserver(org.logevents.LogEventObserver) to configure the observers for logging. Observers are inherited from parents, unless inherit is set to false for setObserver(Logger, LogEventObserver, boolean).

    Author:
    Johannes Brodwall

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel(java.lang.String loggerName,
                     Level level)
        Sets the threshold to log at. All messages lower than the threshold will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        loggerName - The non-nullable name of the logger as per getLogger(java.lang.String)
        level - The nullable name of the threshold. If null, inherit from parent

      • setLevel

                      Level level)
        Sets the threshold to log at. All messages lower than the threshold will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        logger - The non-nullable logger
        level - The nullable name of the threshold. If null, inherit from parent

      • setObserver

        public LogEventObserver setObserver(Logger logger,
                                    LogEventObserver observer,
                                    boolean inheritParentObserver)
        Sets the observer that should be used to receive LogEvents for this logger and children.
        Parameters:
        logger - The logger to set
        observer - The nullable observer. Use CompositeLogEventObserver to register more than one observer
        inheritParentObserver - If true, observers set on the observers will also receive log events
        Returns:
        The previous observer. Useful if you want to temporarily set the observer

      • setObserverNames

        public void setObserverNames(LoggerConfiguration logger,

        Adds a new observer to the current observers for the specified logger

      • configure

        public void configure()
        Reads logging configuration from LogEventConfigurator configured with ServiceLoader. If none exists, uses DefaultLogEventConfigurator. This method is called the first time getInstance() is called.

      • getConfigurators

        public java.util.List<LogEventConfigurator> getConfigurators()

      • reset

        public void reset(LogEventObserver rootObserver,
                  Level rootLevel)
        Logs to the console at level INFO, or level WARN if running in JUnit.
        Parameters:
        rootObserver - The observer used for getRootLogger
        rootLevel - The logging threshold for getRootLogger

      • reset

        protected boolean isRunningInsideJunit()
